fields.text: You're about to reset the board. Are you sure?

moveRoutine.Note: Clear activeButton flag so player can start with the same cup that ended the previous game.

clickRoutine.Note: Get properties from this button needed for this operation.
Determine the ID of the next cup holder from the array
Get the ID of the next marble from the hand and set the parent and random x,y coords for it in the next cup holder ID.
Determine if this marble is being left in the mancala. If it is, call another routine to adjust the x,y coords.
Click the button to update the count
Determine if index is the last one.
Determine if index is the last one but in a different way to get a different Boolean answer
Add 1 to the index (unless this is the last one) to get this button ready for the next click.
Set the index back to 0 if this is the last one.
Determine if Kalah rules are in effect and if the empty capture rule is in effect

moveRoutine.Note: Check to see if the current button is already the active one.
Select and count the marbles in this cup holder.
Move the marbles to the hand, but skip if this button is already active (in case the marble distribution loops all the way around the board.).
Set the index to the next cup holder, but skip if this button is already active because btnMove handles it from there.).
Set the array and mancala name used by this button.).
Declare this button active and click btnMove to start moving marbles).

kalahRoutine.Note: Take the nextIndex number and subract one to get the index number of the most recently played marble.
Determine the ID of the holder of the most recently played marble from the array.
Determine if the hand is empty.
Determine if the currentCup is only going to have one marble in it.
Determine if the currentIndex is on the same row as the player.
Determine if both the hand is empty and the currentCup has only one marble and store that in the variable 'capture.'
If the previous conditions is true, also check that the last marble is being dropped in the correct row and store that in the variable 'capture.'
If 'capture' is true, then determine the holder opposite the one where the last marble was played and move those marbles to the correct mancala..
If 'capture' is true, then move the last marble into the mancala, but only if empty capture rule is on.

info.name: Mancala
info.attribution:
The game layout, game board, and library image were done by LawDawg96 and released to the Public Domain under CC0. The game pieces are from the VirtualTabletop assets.

Note: to use the automatic marble moving features, click on the hand icon above or below the cup you want to move.  Keep clicking the same icon until all the marbles are distributed.
info.description: Move marbles around pits in board to collect your own and opponents marbles.  Player with most marbles wins.
